No, man, no!
No!

248
00:30:59,790 --> 00:31:01,880
No!

249
00:31:01,920 --> 00:31:03,260
No!

250
00:31:18,940 --> 00:31:22,400
It's on the house, kiddo,
you know that.

251
00:31:22,480 --> 00:31:24,780
One root beer.

252
00:31:26,780 --> 00:31:29,530
I can't do anything.

253
00:31:29,620 --> 00:31:34,080
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

254
00:31:34,160 --> 00:31:36,290
Yeah, way off.

255
00:31:40,880 --> 00:31:45,800
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

256
00:31:45,840 --> 00:31:48,880
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

257
00:31:48,970 --> 00:31:52,890
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

258
00:31:52,970 --> 00:31:58,140
And I say I'm dead and I move.

259
00:31:58,190 --> 00:32:01,520
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

260
00:32:01,560 --> 00:32:05,940
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

261
00:32:06,030 --> 00:32:09,160
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

262
00:32:09,240 --> 00:32:10,950
You high?

263
00:32:11,030 --> 00:32:14,200
- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

264
00:32:14,290 --> 00:32:18,290
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

265
00:32:18,370 --> 00:32:21,040
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

266
00:32:21,080 --> 00:32:25,710
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Move it!

267
00:32:25,760 --> 00:32:30,590
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

268
00:32:30,680 --> 00:32:35,140
- It's getting too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

269
00:32:35,220 --> 00:32:37,640
Do you know someone named T-bird?

270
00:32:37,730 --> 00:32:42,310
He had a friend who shouldn't have
played with knives. Like the coat?

271
00:32:42,400 --> 00:32:44,980
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

272
00:32:45,070 --> 00:32:48,570
- Check it out.
- He was already dead.

273
00:32:48,650 --> 00:32:53,990
- He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

274
00:32:54,080 --> 00:32:57,750
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

275
00:32:57,830 --> 00:33:00,250
Get away from there!

276
00:33:00,330 --> 00:33:03,460
Cops!
Get outta here!

277
00:33:03,500 --> 00:33:06,920
Leave it, run!

278
00:33:12,300 --> 00:33:16,640
Oh, great, great.

279
00:33:16,720 --> 00:33:19,310
Guy shows up looking like
a mime from hell...

280
00:33:19,390 --> 00:33:21,690
and you lose him
right out in the open.

281
00:33:21,770 --> 00:33:27,610
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

282
00:33:27,690 --> 00:33:31,610
Little early
for Devil's Night.

283
00:33:33,200 --> 00:33:35,910
You are very restless.

284
00:33:35,990 --> 00:33:39,200
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

285
00:33:39,290 --> 00:33:43,540
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

286
00:33:55,010 --> 00:33:58,060
There are energies
aligning against you.

287
00:33:58,140 --> 00:34:00,600
Seeing is believing,
isn't it?

288
00:34:11,400 --> 00:34:14,410
Mmm, yummy.

289
00:34:19,740 --> 00:34:23,710
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down
to the foundation.

290
00:34:23,790 --> 00:34:27,000
Nobody cleared
this little event with me.

291
00:34:27,080 --> 00:34:28,840
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

292
00:34:28,920 --> 00:34:31,590
You must be
awfully disappointed.

293
00:34:31,670 --> 00:34:35,010
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

294
00:34:35,050 --> 00:34:37,350
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

295
00:34:37,430 --> 00:34:42,020
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

296
00:34:42,060 --> 00:34:44,640
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

297
00:34:44,730 --> 00:34:47,900
an introspective moment of silence
for poor, old Tin Tin.

298
00:34:50,570 --> 00:34:53,150
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

299
00:34:53,240 --> 00:34:56,030
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

300
00:34:56,070 --> 00:34:58,910
That's very reassuring.

301
00:34:58,950 --> 00:35:03,000
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

302
00:35:03,080 --> 00:35:07,540
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

303
00:35:07,630 --> 00:35:09,460
Call it my need to know.

304
00:35:43,080 --> 00:35:45,660
Let go, you creep!

305
00:35:49,000 --> 00:35:50,750
Nah.

306
00:35:50,840 --> 00:35:54,130
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

307
00:35:55,550 --> 00:35:57,930
He couldn't have stopped.

308
00:35:58,010 --> 00:36:02,300
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

309
00:36:02,390 --> 00:36:05,430
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

310
00:36:05,520 --> 00:36:07,520
Sometimes.

311
00:36:09,560 --> 00:36:14,320
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

312
00:36:15,480 --> 00:36:18,990
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

313
00:36:35,920 --> 00:36:40,510
Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

314
00:36:40,590 --> 00:36:44,930
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

315
00:36:45,010 --> 00:36:48,430
Annie... look at that.

316
00:36:48,520 --> 00:36:52,730
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments... "

317
00:36:52,810 --> 00:36:54,860
What is this, a petition?

318
00:36:54,940 --> 00:36:57,820
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

319
00:36:57,900 --> 00:37:01,990
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction in that neighborhood?

320
00:37:02,070 --> 00:37:07,950
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

321
00:37:08,040 --> 00:37:11,580
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

322
00:37:11,670 --> 00:37:15,670
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

323
00:37:22,680 --> 00:37:26,430
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

324
00:37:26,470 --> 00:37:28,600
I'm cool.

325
00:37:28,680 --> 00:37:33,440
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

326
00:37:33,480 --> 00:37:35,980
Ah, I owe you one!

327
00:37:36,070 --> 00:37:38,110
Yeah, right.

328
00:37:38,150 --> 00:37:40,320
Damn.

329
00:38:05,760 --> 00:38:09,640
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

330
00:38:09,720 --> 00:38:13,390
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

331
00:38:38,290 --> 00:38:40,920
- There's a big fucking bird over there.
- * No more **

332
00:38:40,960 --> 00:38:42,970
Huh?

333
00:38:44,130 --> 00:38:47,010
It's a squab.

334
00:38:47,090 --> 00:38:49,720
Come here, bird.

335
00:38:49,810 --> 00:38:51,890
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

336
00:38:51,970 --> 00:38:54,310
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

337
00:38:54,350 --> 00:38:56,980
Here, birdie, birdie.

338
00:38:57,020 --> 00:39:00,020
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

339
00:39:02,650 --> 00:39:05,860
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

340
00:39:05,950 --> 00:39:08,530
Here, Funboy.

341
00:39:10,870 --> 00:39:12,830
What the fuck?

342
00:39:19,210 --> 00:39:23,760
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

343
00:39:23,840 --> 00:39:26,010
Look at him.

344
00:39:26,050 --> 00:39:28,930
Don't sweat it.

345
00:39:30,640 --> 00:39:33,680
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

346
00:39:41,610 --> 00:39:46,450
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

347
00:39:48,450 --> 00:39:53,370
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

348
00:39:53,450 --> 00:39:56,960
You need professional help.

349
00:39:58,750 --> 00:40:01,340
Bingo!

350
00:40:01,420 --> 00:40:04,050
He shoots! He scores!

351
00:40:14,180 --> 00:40:17,890
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

352
00:40:17,980 --> 00:40:20,690
Stop me if you heard this one.

353
00:40:20,770 --> 00:40:23,690
Jesus Christ
walks into a hotel.

354
00:40:25,780 --> 00:40:27,570
Ow.

355
00:40:29,110 --> 00:40:31,870
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

356
00:40:31,950 --> 00:40:35,490
Don't you ever fucking die?

357
00:40:35,580 --> 00:40:37,830
"Can you put me up for the night?"

358
00:40:43,340 --> 00:40:47,920
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it... Fuck, does it hurt?

359
00:40:48,010 --> 00:40:50,050
Oh, God.

360
00:40:50,130 --> 00:40:54,220
Look what you've done
to my sheets.

361
00:41:18,450 --> 00:41:20,460
I've got a gun
in my pocket.

362
00:41:23,500 --> 00:41:26,210
You're happy to see me,
aren't you?

363
00:41:43,980 --> 00:41:47,860
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

364
00:41:55,700 --> 00:41:59,540
Look.

365
00:41:59,580 --> 00:42:04,080
Mother is the name for God
on the lips and hearts of all children.

366
00:42:04,170 --> 00:42:08,920
Do you understand?
Morphine is bad for you.

367
00:42:19,350 --> 00:42:24,150
Your daughter is out there
on the streets waiting for you.

368
00:42:53,920 --> 00:42:57,600
If I wanted ice,
I would have asked for ice!

369
00:42:57,680 --> 00:42:59,930
Now fill it up!

370
00:43:01,020 --> 00:43:04,390
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

371
00:43:04,480 --> 00:43:07,150
I really need this.

372
00:43:13,690 --> 00:43:15,700
All right.

373
00:43:15,740 --> 00:43:19,700
You burn yourself
playing with matches?

374
00:43:19,740 --> 00:43:22,330
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

375
00:43:22,410 --> 00:43:24,870
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

376
00:43:24,960 --> 00:43:27,880
This is a first.
Do I bow or do I curtsy?

377
00:43:27,960 --> 00:43:30,750
Get my friend here
a glass of blood.

378
00:43:30,840 --> 00:43:34,260
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

379
00:43:34,340 --> 00:43:37,260
Hey, good night, Darla.

380
00:43:39,680 --> 00:43:43,390
You stay put right there.

381
00:43:51,440 --> 00:43:54,900
Get away, steamhead.

382
00:44:14,170 --> 00:44:16,130
Shh.

383
00:44:26,060 --> 00:44:31,810
As you can see, I'm
on the corner of 27th and Washington...

384
00:44:31,860 --> 00:44:34,610
- the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

385
00:44:34,690 --> 00:44:37,650
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

386
00:44:37,740 --> 00:44:40,700
across the street from me
was totally demolished by fire.

387
00:44:40,740 --> 00:44:42,910
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

388
00:44:42,990 --> 00:44:45,120
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

389
00:44:45,200 --> 00:44:49,960
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police...

390
00:44:50,040 --> 00:44:52,960
Freeze!

391
00:44:53,040 --> 00:44:56,550
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

392
00:44:56,590 --> 00:44:58,590
Fuck.

393
00:45:00,550 --> 00:45:02,720
Good likeness.

394
00:45:02,800 --> 00:45:06,520
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

395
00:45:06,600 --> 00:45:08,850
You still have your hat on.

396
00:45:12,770 --> 00:45:14,860
I gotta sit down.

397
00:45:15,650 --> 00:45:17,610
Shi...

398
00:45:17,650 --> 00:45:20,530
Holy Shit.

399
00:45:21,990 --> 00:45:24,620
Say...

400
00:45:24,700 --> 00:45:29,000
are you some kind of... ghost?

401
00:45:29,080 --> 00:45:31,040
Boo!

402
00:45:38,630 --> 00:45:43,180
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

403
00:45:45,180 --> 00:45:49,270
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

404
00:45:49,350 --> 00:45:52,440
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

405
00:45:52,520 --> 00:45:57,110
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

406
00:45:57,190 --> 00:45:59,820
Come on. Read the file.

407
00:45:59,900 --> 00:46:04,240
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

408
00:46:04,320 --> 00:46:07,540
Her body finally just gave it up.

409
00:46:07,580 --> 00:46:11,460
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

410
00:46:21,340 --> 00:46:23,260
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

411
00:46:23,340 --> 00:46:27,350
Hey.

412
00:46:28,760 --> 00:46:31,600
You okay?

413
00:46:31,640 --> 00:46:34,350
I saw her.

414
00:46:35,980 --> 00:46:39,280
I saw her
through your eyes.

415
00:46:39,360 --> 00:46:41,440
You stayed with her
the whole time.

416
00:46:41,530 --> 00:46:46,990
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

417
00:46:47,070 --> 00:46:51,830
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

418
00:46:51,870 --> 00:46:54,830
Give me something
I could work with.

419
00:46:54,870 --> 00:46:57,130
Yeah.

420
00:46:57,170 --> 00:46:59,630
Look, I...

421
00:46:59,670 --> 00:47:02,170
Why didn't you do
something about it?

422
00:47:02,260 --> 00:47:05,590
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

423
00:47:05,680 --> 00:47:09,140
would talk after
what happened to you?

424
00:47:09,220 --> 00:47:12,430
I kept asking
questions and...

425
00:47:12,520 --> 00:47:15,190
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

426
00:47:19,190 --> 00:47:21,150
This your wife?

427
00:47:21,230 --> 00:47:25,700
Yeah, we, uh... Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

428
00:47:27,570 --> 00:47:30,530
It's funny.

429
00:47:30,580 --> 00:47:34,580
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

430
00:47:34,660 --> 00:47:38,170
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

431
00:47:38,250 --> 00:47:41,250
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

432
00:47:50,890 --> 00:47:55,350
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

433
00:48:00,020 --> 00:48:03,230
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

434
00:48:06,860 --> 00:48:09,570
I thought I'd use
your front door.

435
00:48:12,620 --> 00:48:18,460
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

436
00:48:20,000 --> 00:48:22,340
Yeah.

437
00:48:26,880 --> 00:48:29,470
Yeah.

438
00:48:29,550 --> 00:48:33,060
I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

439
00:48:33,140 --> 00:48:36,270
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

440
00:48:36,350 --> 00:48:39,400
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

441
00:48:39,480 --> 00:48:42,730
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

442
00:48:42,770 --> 00:48:45,320
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

443
00:48:45,400 --> 00:48:49,820
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

444
00:48:49,910 --> 00:48:54,910
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

445
00:48:54,990 --> 00:48:57,460
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

446
00:48:57,540 --> 00:49:00,040
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

447
00:49:00,120 --> 00:49:05,630
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

448
00:49:05,710 --> 00:49:08,470
You ain't lost everything.

449
00:49:08,550 --> 00:49:13,640
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

450
00:49:13,720 --> 00:49:17,310
Fair enough. Catch.

451
00:49:18,430 --> 00:49:20,850
Aah! Jesus.

452
00:49:20,940 --> 00:49:23,360
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

453
00:49:23,440 --> 00:49:25,440
What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

454
00:49:25,480 --> 00:49:29,150
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

455
00:49:29,240 --> 00:49:33,200
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

456
00:49:33,280 --> 00:49:37,410
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

457
00:49:37,500 --> 00:49:40,160
Yeah.

458
00:49:40,210 --> 00:49:45,380
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

459
00:49:45,460 --> 00:49:48,710
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister?
